column5: Has anyone used or heard anything about these products?  http://stores.sternmate.com/-strse-SternMate/Categories.bok  http://www.emmrod.com/  http://www.thundermistlures.com/t-turn-how-to-use.php.  Thanks Mike
The Emrod looks cool. It is modeled off of the Stub-Caster from the 60's -70's. The videos seem like it would work well off of shore. I have seen them advertised on kijiji.

What is old is new again.  The owner makes it sound like he invented it, maybe refined should be the claim.  Just to clarify, I have the huge rooster tail, the loss of bottom echo at high speeds and have adjusted as much as I can within the parameters of the current transducer mount.  Anything over 15mph and the bottom is gone.
You appear to have found the K-TEL of fishing. If you call now....our operators are waiting....have your credit card ready.
Had the same problem with my transducer last season.Seems i had it tilted the wrong way.Make sure to tip the transducer so the trailing edge is lower than the leading edge.Worked for me.
I tried that and the rooster was reduced, but still loose the bottom. Yes, I love gadgets!
